meanings.definition: A person or animal that gobbles.
meanings.sent1: The gobblers at the farm were always eager for their meals.
meanings.sent2: The turkey was a real gobbler, finishing its food in seconds.
meanings.sent3: The gobblers in the barn raced each other to see who could eat the fastest.
meanings.sent4: Her little brother was a gobbler when it came to finishing his snacks.
meanings.sent5: The hungry gobbler pecked at the seeds with excitement.

meanings.definition: A slang term for the muscles in the neck.
meanings.sent1: She massaged her sore gobblers after a long day at work.
meanings.sent2: The athlete's strong gobblers helped him tackle opponents effectively.
meanings.sent3: His gobblers felt tight after sleeping in an awkward position.
meanings.sent4: The singer's gobblers strained as she hit the high notes.
meanings.sent5: He could feel his gobblers tense up as he lifted the heavy weight.

meanings.definition: A slang term for a person who eats quickly or greedily.
meanings.sent1: At the buffet, he was known as the fastest gobbler among his friends.
meanings.sent2: The kids called him a gobbler because he always finished his lunch first.
meanings.sent3: She teased her brother, calling him a little gobbler for gobbling up his snacks.
meanings.sent4: During the picnic, the gobbler devoured all the sandwiches in no time.
meanings.sent5: The pizza disappeared quickly, thanks to the hungry gobbler in the group.
